src:
Begynte å gråte etter utskjelling
I en ny bok forteller Nicklas Bendtner om da Arsenal-legenden Liam Brady var nær ved å kaste ham ut av klubben før karrieren skjøt fart.
01 Nov 2019, 14:07 by NTB I
Tirsdag kommer den tidligere Rosenborg-spilleren med boken «Begge sider». Der forteller FC København-angriperen om et sammenstøt med Arsenals akademisjef Liam Brady i 2004. Episoden skjedde i november det året, og det hadde ikke gått tre måneder siden Bendtner var hentet til London og Arsenal.
Det er avisen The Guardian som skriver om historien som det danske nyhetsbyrået Ritzau gjengir.
Bendtner ble kalt inn på Bradys kontor. 16-åringen ante fred og ingen fare. Den talentfulle dansken hadde akkurat startet å trene med førstelaget under Arsène Wengers ledelse.
- Jeg forventet ikke at noe var galt, for Wenger hadde allerede rost meg mange ganger mens jeg trente med førstelaget. Men der tok jeg feil, skriver Bendtner.
Kjeft
- «Hør her, gutt», sa han. «Jeg tror ikke at du er klar over hva som er på spill her, og hvor mange gutter som ville ha gitt sin høyre arm for å få den sjansen du har fått. Det tror jeg ikke du er klar over», lyder Bendtners gjengivelse av samtalen.
Bendtner skriver at han fikk en lengre tale om at han var en stor fisk fra den lille dammen Danmark, og at fotball ikke automatisk er noe man er den beste til.

- Jeg fikk høre at jeg ikke skulle tenke på biler, dyre klokker og modellkjærester. Det var kun noe man fikk når man gjorde seg fortjent til det. Og det kunne utelukkende skje gjennom hardt arbeid, forteller angriperen.

Bendtner lovet umiddelbart bot og bedring, men Liam Brady hadde allerede bestemt seg for at Bendtner skulle sendes hjem.
- Nei, det skal jeg ikke, sa Bendtner og begynte å gråte.
- Det var første gang at jeg gråt foran noen andre enn foreldrene mine. Det gikk opp for meg hvor mye jeg ville bli værende i klubben. Arsenal var drømmen min, og jeg var i ferd med å ødelegge den eneste planen jeg noen gang hadde laget for meg selv, forteller dansken.
Hierarki
Bendtner forteller også om hvordan han slet med å finne sin plass i Arsenals hierarki. Blant annet brukte den daværende Arsenals-stjernen Thierry Henry tre berøringer i en øvelse der det kun var tillatt med to. Bendtner skrek opp og sa fra, men ble hysjet ned av Henry.
Like etter hadde Bendtner tre berøringer på ballen og ble straffet med det samme. Bendtner klaget over at reglene ikke var like for alle.

Etter treningen tok Henry en prat med Bendtner. Den samtalen varte i to timer. Henry satte unggutten på plass og kom samtidig med gode råd.

- Jeg sugde alt til meg, og det endte med at vi ga hverandre en klem. Jeg trodde at saken var ute av verden. Det var den ikke. Den neste måneden fikk jeg ikke trene med førstelaget, sier dansken.
text:
Started crying after scolding
In a new book, Nicklas Bendtner talks about when Arsenal legend Liam Brady was close to throwing him out of the club before his career accelerated.
01 Nov 2019, 14:07 by NTB I
On Tuesday, the former Rosenborg player comes with the book "Both sides". There, the FC Copenhagen striker tells of a clash with Arsenal's academy manager Liam Brady in 2004. The episode happened in November that year, and it had not been three months since Bendtner was brought to London and Arsenal.
The Guardian newspaper writes about the story that the Danish news agency Ritzau reproduces.
Bendtner was called into Brady's office. 16-year-old ante peace and no danger. The talented Danish had just started training with the first team under Arsène Wenger's leadership.
- I didn't expect anything was wrong, because Wenger had already praised me many times while training with the first team. But there I was wrong, writes Bendtner.
Swear
"Listen, boy," he said. "I don't think you're aware of what's at stake here, and how many guys would have given their right arm to get the chance you've got. I don't think you're aware of that, "says Bendtner's rendition of the conversation.
Bendtner writes that he got a lengthy speech that he was a big fish from the small pond Denmark, and that football is not automatically something you are the best at.

- I was told not to think about cars, expensive watches and model girlfriends. It was only something you got when you earned it. And that could only happen through hard work, the attacker says.

Bendtner promised immediate remedy and improvement, but Liam Brady had already decided that Bendtner should be sent home.
"No, I won't," Bendtner said, and began to cry.
- It was the first time I cried in front of someone other than my parents. It dawned on me how much I wanted to stay in the club. Arsenal was my dream and I was about to destroy the only plan I had ever made for myself, says the Danish.
hierarchy
Bendtner also talks about how he struggled to find his place in Arsenal's hierarchy. Among other things, the then Arsenal star Thierry Henry used three touches in an exercise where only two were allowed. Bendtner screamed and said, but was taken down by Henry.
Shortly after, Bendtner had three touches on the ball and was punished immediately. Bendtner complained that the rules were not the same for everyone.

After the training, Henry had a chat with Bendtner. That conversation lasted two hours. Henry put the young boy in place and came up with good advice.

- I sucked everything on myself, and we ended up hugging each other. I thought the case was out of the world. It wasn't. The next month I did not train with the first team, says the Danish.
